did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection consists of slides, correspondence, and research materials of Claire Holt.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Claire Holt was born in Riga, Latvia in 1901. She served as a reporter for the The New York World, publishing dance reviews. She traveled to Indonesia in 1930, where she studied dance, working with the anthropologist Willem Stutterheim and then assisting the Swedish dance archivist and patron Rolf de Mare with his photo and film documentation of Indonesian dance. She returned to the U.S. and served as a research assistant to Margaret Mead, as a research analyst for the Office of Strategic Services, and as a foreign affairs specialist for the State Department. She then came to Cornell University, where in 1962, she helped found the Modern Indonesia Project.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of slides of Indonesia created for the Cornell Indonesian Arts Project. Subjects include art, architecture, ceremonies, landscapes, painting, people, sculpture, textiles, and theater. Collection also includes research materials, typescript notes about a trip to Indonesia in 1955-1956, index cards relating to Holt's work and travel in Indonesia, and materials from the dedication of the Claire Holt Memorial Collection Inauguration Ceremony at Lembaga, August 6, 1970.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Claire Holt papers, #14-27-2648. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See digital versions of some of this material here: http://resolver.library.cornell.edu/misc/5597787.
The Claire Holt Collection of Indonesian Dance and Related Arts is located in the Dance Division of the New York Public Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: See also: Claire Holt Papers digital collection (NX580.A1 C55 2002), which consists of digitized slides from this collection.
